title: (x) Swashy italic - Adobe Caslon {Florian}
content:
At first I thought it was Hoefler Text, but there are some differences.

Here is a straight up shot.  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/g-man77/2670484503/sizes/l/in/set-721576023...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014301/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/g-man77/2670484503/sizes/l/in/set-72157602350302901/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/g-man77/2670484503/sizes/l/in/set-72157602350302901/")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [2670483481\_37d8a9a85d.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014301/http:/typophile.com/files/2670483481_37d8a9a85d.jpg) | 168.07 KB |

 [‹ (x) Dennis logo retro script - Philly Sport Script {Florian}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014301/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47775 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Which Didot is this? - Linotype Didot {Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014301/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47757 "Go to next forum topic")
author: armin

comments.content:
Hi Armin,

looks like [Adobe Caslon Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014301/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/adobe_caslon_pro_bold_italic/) by [Carol Twombly](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014301/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Carol%252BTwombly), with Swashes and Osf (but no ‘Th’ ligature – shame! ;-))  
F

I think that’s a definitely, and awesome, because Adobe Caslon is almost certainly my favorite serif font :D

Screenshot:  
 [http://img120.imageshack.us/img120/9917/martinjameskl5.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014301/http:/img120.imageshack.us/img120/9917/martinjameskl5.png)

Edit: and yeah, it looks like they forewent the Th ligature; see my image for comparison.

Peace,  
JT
